Eight hours later, my new Kindle, which had been off, was down to 45% on the charge.  Tried again.  Starting at 100%, after three hours of reading, was down to 52%.  Contacted customer support for a replacement, as obviously the battery wasn't charging properly.  Only had to go through three reps to get the return label...a personal achievement!Notified the replacement had not been delivered (at a time my wife and I were both home) by the USPS. Reported it to them and Amazon.  After four reps, got a replacement sent.  It arrives with the one that was "undeliverable".  Charged both.  Batteries seem to be OK.  Getting ready to contact Amazon to return one of them.  Screen locks up.  Software was not the latest version that was on my wife's (working) new Kindle.  Tried the other one.  Same; screen locks up when downloading a book, not the latest software.  Both had to be force rebooted to unfreeze.  Both locked up again.  Again, had to force reboot to unfreeze.Tired of having my life sucked out by defective products, contacted support to return two, and *maybe* try again.  After going through eight reps, my patience was at an end, and went for the return and refund.  This was the most unhelpful customer support I have ever experienced from Amazon.I do not recommend purchasing the new Paperwhite Kindles until they work the bugs out, if at all.  My older reader seems like it will have to do for the foreseeable future.Edited to add: Had to return my wife's new Kindle paperwhite.  Would not stay connected to the WiFi.  Would not allow books to be shared from our family library.  (Books showed up fine on her old Kindle, her phone, and her computer - just not the new one.)  She's now stuck with her older Kindle.All in all, a pretty unpleasant experience, Amazon.  Now I'm waiting with bated (thanks Kaila - pokking autocorrect) breath to see how the refund process and credit for two older Kindles traded in for the new ones will go.  (I'm guessing not well.)2nd Edit - finally got the refund after going back and forth; seems they couldn't figure out their own order number system.  Got nothing for the two Kindles I 'traded-in' for the new Kindle.  (Don't really care if they are donating the Kindles to people who can use them...)

author: toaster
title: Arrived with dead pixel (bright spot with light on when it should be dark)
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Was pretty bummed out to get a unit with a dead e-ink pixel. Will probably return the unit (still within refund window).My 2nd gen paperwhite is still going strong. I guess quality control has slipped since then?

author: Bemberly
title: Jury's still out on ths one.
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I received this early because I pre-ordered it but Amazon wouldn't let me review it because it wasn't really released yet.  It's probably a good thing because it gave me a little more time with it.  That being said, I'm not that crazy about it after all and I would still be using my kindle paperwhite (previous generation) if the charging port didn't stop working (coincidentally) the day this was announced, (go figure). That's the first thing to go on all Amazon devices whether it's a Kindle Fire HD or Reader. Amazon needs to check themselves.For the New Kindle Paperwhite the SCREEN looks more like a tablet than a book.  I thought the whole purpose of the Paperwhite was that it looked like the pages of a book. Soft and creamy as in my picture.  The picture on the left is the NEW PW and on the right is the OLD PW (same degree). Even though the Old PW is creamy it's much easier to read and brighter in it's own right.  The New PW now has that blue light we were trying to get away from, so it's harder on the eyes and you will spend less time reading from it. It defeats the purpose. (If it ain't broke don't fix it). Hope you can see the difference in the pictures.  Also the battery life is not as long as other generations. I love Amazon devices and I have all of them.  Not loving this one yet but I guess I don't  have a choice but to get used to it. I hope I do. The size is exactly the same but flatter so it doesn't fit your old case. It's ever so slightly loose. What's that about?  It is waterproof though that was never my concern.  The screen is completely flat with no ridge (hence the waterproofing). I do still like it because it is a Paperwhite.  I just don't love it...yet?  Oh, you also have an extra step when you want to change the font. It's now a drop down menu.  Before you just clicked on the "Aa" and there you were.Well I hope this helps.  It's not bad it's just not what I was happy with.

author: futurefan
title: A Little Disappointed
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: Without Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: After five years or so, I decided to upgrade from the Generation 5 Paperwhite to the latest (Gen 10) model, hoping that there would be significant improvements. It is a little sharper in pixel esolution, but not much more black and white than the dark to light gray of the Gen 5. It is a little faster in response as well, but not much. I did have a problem getting the Kindle to properly detect Library changes or receive samples, but after talking with someone at Amazon, we were able to resolve the problem by de-registering and re-registering the Paperwhite to get it working properly.I would really like to see better contrast on the black to white scale, and hope that Amazon is still trying to bring about color e-ink in the future.In short, this latest generation of the Paperwhite is a good device if you don't have an earlier generation of the device, but I would recommend waiting a little longer if you have an earlier generation and are looking for something much better for the cost of getting something new.

author: Dropbear
title: Battery drains rapidly
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Everything about this new Kindle is perfect except the battery life. You can actually watch the percentage drop every couple of minutes.*UPDATE*Replaced it and the new one seems to be delivering on battery expectations. Updating stars from 2 to 4!

author: Leanna
title: Returned it and got a new 7th gen
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: If you have had a kindle before, then you will be familiar with the 10th gen and in general how it works.Pros:*More control over page format and layout, font, etc.*Waterproof, the screen is continuous from edge to page. No hairs or lint getting trapped.*Works with bluetooth headphonesCons*The brightness is too bright, brighter seeming than my last gen paperwhite (this is terrible at night)*No blue light filter this would have been nice for reading at night.*Not USB-C for charging for a new version this is stuck in the past.*The home screen sucks, take me right to my library!*I'm not a fan if the current cases (no rubber lining so less shock absorption), hopefully this will change.*Takes longer to "wake up" after hitting the power button or opening the cover than previous models*Battery life is terrible!*The screen isn't textured like the older versions so it no longer feels like paper. This not only feels nice but helped me to navigate the page from the rest of the kindle.Everything about this is terrible except for the very minor pros. I loved my old kindles so I hoped they would continue to get better like older ones have in the past. They went backwards with this one. It feels like an unfinished product rushed to get it out in time for the holidays. The cons outweigh the pros by too much.

author: Joan Sawyer
title: I don’t like anything about this device.
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I don’t like the paper white kindle at all. I am not interested in your recommendations; they just crowd up the screen. Organizing the books into categories is time consuming and awkward. It is also annoying that your description of it never stated that you couldn’t listen to audiobooks unless you had blue tooth. If I knew I’d have to buy Bluetooth headphones I wouldn’t have bought this device.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not worth it. False advertising. Lack of promised features
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: This does not have text to speech, only voice view. Voice view makes it hard to navigate to the book. It also doesn't have the features that the uk version has. The uk has immersion reading. You can play the audible version of the book and read along with the text. Our version the page disappears. It will even highlight the words as they are spoken. I bought this for a special education class. I feel ripped off that we do not have the same features as Europe. It took 2 hours on the phone with an out of country customer service to realize that we do not have the same features. She kept instructing me to touch the center of the screen for these features. When the features do not exist, touching the center if the screen is a waste of time. I am sorry I purchased it. Worse then my older paperwhite. Feels cheap, page looks funny.  I can listen to audible on my phone. I don't need a paperwhite to hear my books. It didn't deliver features promosed.promised.

author: grammy H
title: This is strictly an e-reader
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I own a Kindle Fire which was only about $50 a couple of years ago.  I ordered the new Paperwhite because it promised longer battery time between charges.  But I returned it immediately because you can't adjust the background light at all and there was very little adjustment possible for font size.  I much prefer the Fire even if I have to plug it in to the charger daily. An important feature that was missing from the Paperwhite is the ability to set a time that it changes from blue-white to amber light when you are near bedtime.

author: Breezy
title: The addition of Audible isn’t as great as it should have been.
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I was excited to hear Amazon was finally releasing a new Paperwhite that was waterproof AND had Audible capabilities. I was so excited I didn’t delve further into researching the capabilities and that was a big mistake on my part. I love the immersion reading option on the Kindle app which allows me to listen to Audible while following along in the book as it highlights the words. I assumed this new Paperwhite would have the immersion reading capabilities. Nope! As you listen to the book, you must stay on the Audible player or it stops the book. You can’t even browse the Kindle or Audible stores while continuing to listen to your book. Not worth the $180 in my opinion for basically only having the benefit of having a waterproof device and storage to fit my Audible books. Amazon still has not made any major technological advancements to the Paperwhites since the first one was released, which is a HUGE disappointment.

author: Amazon Customer
title: UNLIMITED KINDLE 6 MONTH OFF
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Great product, mother and mother-in-law love.  Read the fine print for the Unlimited 6mo, this is for only one kinder per buyer account.

author: KimberlyAnne
title: Worth the upgrade from PW3
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: What’s in the box:Kindle PaperwhiteCharging CableScreen/Light:The first thing you’ll notice is a smooth, flush screen that not only looks amazing, but is also very responsive. Text is crispy and clear in all lighting settings and while using inverted black & white text. The screen is very prone to fingerprints, but luckily they are not noticeable while reading. I don’t notice any difference in lighting from the previous Paperwhite. There is no adaptive light or night mode.Look & feel:The 10th Gen Paperwhite is noticeable lighter and a bit smaller than its predecessor. The back is a matte finish which makes it feel comfortable to hold; however, it’s a fingerprint magnet.Waterproof:We finally have a waterproof Paperwhite! Ran it under water with zero issues.Firmware:My Paperwhite shipped with Kindle Firmware Version 5.10.1.1. I received an OTA Firmware update to 5.10.1.2. This is a great update that added some noticeable, helpful features to the Paperwhite (Note: This update is also available for the previous Paperwhite)1)  Create personal  “Themes” which saves the page layout, font and font size.2)  Return library books from your Kindle by long pressing in the cover and selecting return3)  Remaining battery percentage is shown next to the battery symbol.4)  Toolbar labelsAudible:The ability to access my Audible library and the Audible store is a huge plus. You can quickly switch between the Kindle version to Audible by clicking the headphone icon in the button corner. This will automatically turn on Bluetooth & bring you to the Audible book. If you decide you want to go back to reading simply click on the book icon. Note: Bluetooth will remain on until manually turn it off. While listening to an Audible book you can adjust the volume/speed, jump fwd/backward 30 secs, add bookmarks and view/go to chapters. One thing missing that I’d love is a sleep timer.  Immersion reading would also be a nice feature.New Accessibility Features for Paperwhite include:VoiceView which will read your Kindle book to you using (You will need to connect to a Bluetooth speaker)Invert black and white. I love this feature when reading in complete darkness. So much easier on my eyes.Battery:I was a bit concerned the battery performance would be on par with the entry level Kindle that also has Audible & Voice View. I’m happy to say the battery performance on the 10th gen Paperwhite is much better. I’ve read Kindle books for about 12 hours w/light at 50%, listened to Audible for approx 3 hours, played around with settings for maybe 30 minutes, connected to WiFi 24/7 and an OTA update was completed. My battery is currently at 42%.I opted for the 8GB with Special Offers as 8GB will be plenty for my use as keep my Kindle/Audible content in the cloud and only download the books I’m currently reading or listening to. The special offers don’t interfere with reading and I’ve actually found new authors to love with the recommendations.So far I’m loving my Waterproof Paperwhite. It’s everything I’ve wanted in an E-reader at an affordable price. If you’re debating if you need to upgrade your Paperwhite go for it. You won’t regret it.

author: S. K.
title: Potential to be a 5 star product, but not yet.
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Like the reader very much. Size and weight are just right for me. Like that it had lights to read under low light conditions, I didn’t think that I needed this feature initially. Selection of fonts good. Wish that the white letters on black screen were brighter. Would have been nice to have text-to-speech and mp3 support. Audio books from Overdrive are mp3 format.One irritating problem:  when I tap screen to turn a page and it does not turn, the next time I tap the screen it will jumps two pages. This is very consistent and annoying.Battery life is more like one week as I read several hours in a day. I’m ok with this.Overall I like the reader.  If it didn’t have the page jumping problem, I would give it another star.If it had mp3 and TTS, I would give it yet another star.  Potential to be 5 star product. All fixable with a software update I believe.

author: S. Dunton
title: Same lousy battery and hard to use
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Hated it!  Received on Wednesday and returned on Friday.  Battery weeks or days long is nonsense.  I'm a reader (!) and the battery lasts no more than two days.  Same as my first paperwhite.Difficult to search the active books since only three show up by bookcovers rather than a list of titles.  I usually keep four pages of active books because I buy as they come out at 99 cents and read them in no certain order.The back lighting IS an improvement over what I have but wasn't worth it alone as the only positive upgrade.I was VERY disappointed.

author: Delighted Artist
title: Amended Review! Disable the Touchscreen
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I am adding on to my previous review... I never realized that my hands moved so much when I read my Kindle, but I was constantly causing Kindle to page forward and backward which drove me crazy! I could find no setting to freeze or shut down this constant movement in my former Kindle. This new Paperwhite has a new setting that allows you to "Disable the Touchscreen" which is the solution to correct the constant jumping pages... However, you have change this setting every time to start to read!  Also, it takes a long time to turn or start this new Kindle.  The swipe to start takes much longer then my older Kindle! Would I still buy this Kindle over a regular Kindle? Absolutely!  Am I thrilled with the new improvements, NO!  This is my initial review... So what's so much better about this paperwhite? First, it's not as sensitive as my last one! I spent more time going backwards then forward!  No matter how I set my "Settings"  it was just too touchy and too sensitive! This paperwhite with about 25 hours of reading time so far, works like a dream!  If this your FIRST Kindle...Please make note: I get approximately 12 hours from 1 charge on my Paperwite!! NOT WEEKS!  That weeks bit is clarified by saying "if you read 1/2 hour per day!"  Well.... I read 6-8 hours per day! I do use my "Fast Charge" charger and it takes about 3 hours, but I can still read when it's plugged in.I do have the insurance but have never had to use it.  I have had kindles forever and they have been a Godsend because of my eyesight and arthritis in my hands,  However, I am also the worlds biggest klutz!  My Kindles have been dropped on every kind of floor and surface  imaginable. We have tile and hardwood floors at home and my Kindle has flown down the hardwood stairs numerous times! I do keep it in it's case, but the glass has never scratched or broken.I'm looking forward to trying out the new audible features, I'm sure I will be pleased.

author: CH
title: Huge Disappointment
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: Without Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Update:  I purchased another Kindle WITH Cellular connectivity.  Again, a huge disappointment.  This Kindle has de-registered twice.  The connectivity has been spotty at best, and the battery does not last long at all.I have purchased more than 8 Kindles over the years, for myself and as gifts.  I was so excited to see the Cellular Connectivity option since one of the people I bought one for does not have WiFi.  I confirmed with Amazon the one I purchased should have Cellular Connectivity, but was told that will ONLY work if there is NO WiFi available.  This includes WiFi you cannot connect to.  Based on my own research, the one I purchased does not appear to have 3G.  When I asked she assured me it does.  They don't know the product.  Battery life was also disappointing, does not last weeks.  Barely lasted a day.

author: MB
title: Previous Generation Is Better
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I've been a kindle customer for a while. I decided to upgrade to the 10th generation and give my 7th generation to my son. He had a paperwhite with no back light and he really wanted one with built in light for evening/night reading. My husband also has a 7th generation. With all that being said, the new kindle is slower to wake up, it is unresponsive when turning the page and then it skips a page so I have to go back. It does that about a third of the time. The white kindle logo is distracting. My husband's 7th generation kindle has the yellow light; my previous kindle and my new one have the white light. I prefer the yellow light but is not a deal breaker. The battery life is OK so far (comparable with the 7th generation). I did not use the charging cable that came with the kindle so I can't speak to it fitting or not.I don't use it for audio books and the waterproof feature is irrelevant to me. Overall, not much improvement over the previous generation. I have not decided if I'm going to keep it or return it.

author: Punit D.
title: Incorrect Advertised Memory
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: This may be something or nothing at all, but I recently bought a 8gb kindle late November and after a week I needed to delete a book from the device, so through settings I went to device info and I learnt that my device only had 6.23 gb. This is about ¼ less the memory promised for this new kindle edition. I called amazon and talk to a kindle supervisor names Calvin who told me to reset the device to manufacturing settings and this should fix the issue. After doing so it still read 6.23gbs.I don’t know what is considered a big story, but I personally thought that this was. I checked the internet for other complains, I searched “incorrect memory” and “memory problem” for the 2018 kindle paperwhite and didn’t find any similar issues. I know when it comes to tech devices that hold memory it is common for a device to be marginally more or less of flash or solid state memory. This however is off by ¼ which is HUGEE. Amazon markets this device as “All-new Kindle Paperwhite – Now Waterproof with 2x the Storage – Includes Special Offers”.**Update**As soon as I posted my review Amazon called me and clarified that infact the firmware/OS does take up 1.5Gbs+. I feel a certain way way about this... I don't understand how you can advertise 2x the memory compared to the 2017 model. Its not like we're talking about a computer or phone with the OS consuming a few Gbs. This is a 8Gb device  which had 1/4 the memory take by OS.How about Amazon makes the device 9.5Gbs and then sells it as 2x the memory compared to 2017 Kindle model.... hmmm? or clarify under technical details:Memory  > 8Gb**This includes the Firmware/OS memory and actually memory is 6 ~ 6.5Gbs.**Update** Dec. 9thI returned my previous 8gb Kindle paperwhite for th 32Gb version. When I went to device Information it showed this device had a total Storage of 27.02Gbs, which means the firmware/OS take up 5Gbs, but for the 8gb version the firmware/OS only takes up 1.8Gbs........ So please explain that?This is an explicit example of false advertising By Amazon. There is no reason for different Kindles to have different amount of storage taken up by Firmware/OS.

author: Customer
title: Amazon can and has done better.
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I have returned one because of the yellow screen.  It was also non-responsive to touch about 50% of the time and very very slow.  No problem with the power cord.  I have Paperwhite that I bought in 2016 and I loved it.  The last update wrecked the battery, so I ordered this new version.  I wasn’t interest in the audio feature as I have dealt with crappy speakers on Kindle products (including my Fire HDX 8.9) for years. I also wasn’t interestd unless it had Immersion reading.  Switching back and from audio to reading is awkward and distracting. I need the earphone plug port.  Can’t use earbuds and the headphones get incredibly hot. I have some over ear hinge sets with small light foam ear pads that sit on the outer ear (Panasonic) that are all I can use but they don’t come wireless.  External speakers are out of the question because of living situation.  My devices never go near water so the trade off of a true “paper white” screen vs a dappled yellowish screen for waterproofing isn’t worth it.  I have to set the brightness to around 17 to get the same brightness my old PW had set at 4.  The Fire HDX 8.9 was great...except it was hard on my eyes and then it got very temperamental.  I’m trying not to have it die on me and the Paperwhite was a perfect companion.  Until it wasn’t, with this new version.  I’m keeping this replacement Paperwhite because I need the ereader.  Anyone who has an older version should wait until a better upgrade comes out.  There is nothing about this one that makes the trade worth it.I simply can’t understand why Amazon Would come out with an inferior e-reader for the Audible listening/Immersion reading experience when they push the Immersion experience so hard.  What they did was degrade the actual reading experience.  Amazon can do better because the *have* done better.My experience with Customer Service for the return was excellent.  The secret is to get an actual Kindle CS rep.  I believe you go up a tier and they are more experienced and have more latitude with making adjustments.  And yes, the language barrier can be problematic, especially if one has hearing issues.  But the CS reps have always been courteous, and in this day and age that counts for something.

author: Happy Curmudgeon
title: Expected more but still a good reader.
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Pretty much as expected. Text not as black as I would like and battery while much better than the phone I was using is not lasting as long as some claimed. It's also crashed once in the four days I’ve had it. The Internet browser while called a ”Experimental Browser” probably Beta would be better as it is almost useless which surprised me.

author: Kirk in Chicago
title: Device Will Not Connect to Wifi
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: The device refuses to connect to either of two wifi networks I use all the time. Tech support was no help. So, I cannot make any use of the device. It's going back to Amazon.

author: jaywalking
title: Not much of an upgrade from the previous version
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Not that much different from the last version.  I still like the paperwhite, but this one is still as slow as the last version.  The weight is not noticeably lighter.  The battery seems about the same.  I would not recommend spending money on upgrading if you have the older version of the paperwhite and you think it is okay.

author: m00z
title: Battery Life Sucks!
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: My first Paper White was purchased in 2010. The battery life on that one was a least a month up until I dropped it and it died a horrible death on 11/2. I had already pre-ordered this one so once I got it it took way too much to get it synched to how I work (Collections). The way to get this all transferred was so non-intuitive. I can't believe the developers thought this was an okay way to do things.Also, the battery life on this unit is horrible at this point. I'm still working with power stuff, but this is horrible. This thing only lasts about 3 days right now. My previous one lasted at least 3 weeks.Update: 12/9/18:madelene.mj@gmail.com916 9610853curtis.robinson1960@gmail.com209 507 1174This is an update to my previous review.If in the past you used your tablet (apple or android), then some of this review won’t concern you. I would say go ahead and buy it as you were already dealing with battery life and a lot of the features on this one weren’t available to you.However, if you were a previous Kindle user, don’t buy this. Yet. The reason I originally ordered this one is that it’s water resistant. I’m going on vacation over the holidays and will be in the hot tub and wanted to read in there. I also live in a very hot area and haven’t used my water misters because I didn’t want to ruin my previous Kindle. This one fit in perfect with that.A day or so before my new one arrived, I broke my old one. So, it was fortuitous that I had this pre-ordered.Like I said in my previous review, getting the content the way I had it (Collections), was way too hard to get it that way. This is one of the options that Amazon offered so I would have expected that it would be a seamless transition. Nope.I can't sync my Kindle Unlimited anymore. All I get is the dreaded: The book is currently unable. Please try again at another time, blah, blah when I'm trying to bring down a Kindle Unlimited book (I'm a subscriber)This is after about 8 hours last time I tried.At this time, I can’t in good conscience, recommend this to current Kindle users. I’ve tried so many things to get the battery life on this to be longer than a couple days. But even when it’s just sitting, there’s some process that is consuming battery life.I’ve tried:Disabling the clock. Made no difference.My “light” is set at 5. There’s a primary sleep mode on this unit that does make the display light up brighter than your existing sleep mode. However, I don’t think this is the cause of any issues when it comes to power. It engages when your Kindle has not been in use for hours. This is different than when your Kindle goes to sleep.Wireless is off as well as Blue Tooth.What I do like is the ability to adjust so many settings for reading mode (including whether or not to turn the clock on or off) within the book. I think they call it theme. So many options there to choose from depending on your reading style.Also, I have video of my Kindle showing a green light that indicates that it was fully charged, however it showed it was only at 98%. This really indicates to me that there are definite battery issues between the Kindle operating system and the Kindle itself.I suspect that that Amazon is trying to unify the Kindle Fire and Kindle Paperwhite’s code and they’ve done a horrible job. I don’t think they’ve done any beta testing and released this thinking all was well.It’s not.

author: SusieQ
title: Thinner and lighter, as advertised
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I am still learning my way around some of the new features, but the new Kindle definitely holds a long charge, as noted. There was nothing wrong with the older model I traded in, but the promotion seemed too good to pass up! I regularly use Kindle Unlimited and find I enjoy reading on the Kindle much more than holding a book to read.  Definitely still an amazon fan!

author: kyle oestreich
title: Hard to improve on an already great product but they did it.
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Added waterproofing and audible drove me to trade in my original kindle which lasted the last 5 years. Hopefully this one stands up just as long.My only concern currently is in the previous version, the touch screen was minimally recessed so if placed face down, the screen did not make contact with surfaces, giving it some protection. This new one is flush across the entire front face. It may amount to nothing but increases the off chance of scratches/damage.  Still the device feels solidly build.

author: katcon
title: Love Love Love
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I love my newest e-reader. I have owned every Kindle but the Oasis. This is my favorite. I love that it waterproof with Bluetooth capabilities.I couldn't afford to put out the money all at once with the holidays coming. Thanks Amazon for offering the payment plan.The reader is the perfect size and light weight.I highly recommend this e-reader.

author: Gregory Isaac
title: New software updates improve the experience greatly.
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: My Original Review:I purchased the older model kindle paperwhite on prime day refurbished and absolutely loved it. It had great battery life and I found a not too expensive case for it which made me love it more. Fast forward to today. Ive had the new Kindle Paperwhite for a week and here are some impressions. The battery life is not as good. Not sure if its a software issue but even in airplane mode it seems to drain fairly quickly. I am also having issues with book lag. Every few pages I will tap the screen and the words will just stay there. I tap again and of course it moves two pages. I contacted Amazon and they said simply restart the kindle. That seemed to work for a bit but it started doing it again. It was on several books and not just one so I already tried deleting and reinstalling the books. The Kindle is just a week old so maybe there are some kinks out there that are in the process of being worked out but so far Im regretting turning in my older heavier kindle for the brand new one. If you have the old one and it still seems to be running fine, I would say stick with it until Amazon has some fixes for the new one. The battery life difference can not be understated.Update 12/10/18Praise the Lord: After a month of my kindle being so buggy that i barely touched it Amazon released a software update that from what I can tell has fixed all of the issues that I initially stated above. The pages no longer freeze and the battery seems to be improved. Thanks Amazon for the fix.

author: Erin L
title: Update on battery life review
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: 12/5/18 update:  After writing my original review on the battery life of my Kindle, I was pleasantly surprised that Amazon/Kindle customer service called me directly the next day to troubleshoot.  I was provided some simple steps to take with my Kindle (doing a force reboot, plugging in overnight).  After doing this, my batter issue is no longer there.  It lasts for days/weeks.  I am so happy!I was so excited to get this new Kindle to replace my older one (purchased in 2010).  I am happy with the lighter weight and it’s easier to hold onto.  However, the battery is terrible.  My old one would last weeks.  This one has drained 20% in just 2 hours of reading (backlight off, in airplane mode).  I really hope this is a software issue that will be fixed, or if customer service can help with troubleshooting.  But that’s what you get for something that’s brand new/just released.

author: Malcor
title: Charging Port is too tight
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: Without Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: This new kindle had everything as advertised and I loved it except the one I received had a very tight charging port. When I needed to charge this kindle, I had to try several times before I could insert the USB cable into the charging port (I was afraid I might damage the device if I forced the cable in).  Also, one time it just died and wouldn't want to wake up. I had to reboot the kindle to get it re-started. I had a talk with Amazon's rep and he determined that my kindle was defective and prepared an order to send a replacement to me.  However, he messed up the order and I received a kindle cover instead. I had to call Amazon again to send me a replacement kindle not its cover. I'll receive it in a couple of days and will know if the replacement kindle works OK.

author: Mauricio Garcia
title: misleading advertising
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I bought the Kindle Paperwhite Waterproof with the Kindle Unlimited promotion for 6 months, never applied for my purchase, they tell me that in Amazon that applies for residents in the US, they also explain a series of requirements that are never considered and / or explain the official website of Amazon, therefore I consider that misleading advertising is incurred for people who act in good faith.

author: Keyson27
title: Screen went black twice...
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: Without Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I received my kindle on November 11th but I didn't unbox it until November 18th. This is my 3rd Kindle since 2010, so I am not unfamiliar with the environment.The battery life is far shorter than my 2nd Gen kindle. In two days, I have had to charge twice.Last night the screen went black twice while in use and I had to close and reopen the cover to restart.I normally enjoy the kindle experience but I am considering replacing this one.12/03/18-UpdateI have been using my kindle for about 2 weeks. Since my last review, I have not experienced the screen blacking out. While I am pleased with that, I still wonder what might have caused the issue.I still find the battery life to be shorter but I must state that I am retired and an avid reader so my battery use may not be the norm.Other than that, the kindle is functioning well. Yes, it takes longer to wake but I don't see that as a serious problem.

author: P. D. HENDERSON
title: Overpriced, but It's good enough for what it is
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: ***EDIT***This was originally a 3-star review, but now that I've had it for three months I'm lowering that. I NEVER had these problems with my old Kindle, but this one has reset itself three times in three months. (Not even counting the yep times that the Amazon help line instructed me to manually deregister and/or reset to factory, so kinda give times total in a way).Each time this happens, all my downloaded books are erased and I have to download them all again. One of the main reasons I bought this one was that it had more memory so I could store more books on it. I have a moderate but still limited data plan (15GB), and each time I have to reload all of the 900 books in my "unread" pile it puts me over my monthly limit. So now I am completely dissatisfied with the Paperwhite! There's something fundamentally wrong with it's programming. Maybe someday they'll put out an update that fixes that a but until then its value is reduced considerable.***END OF EDIT***My old (very old) Kindle isn't usable any more, so I got another one. I used to have a Kindle Touch - they don't even make those anymore; haven't for years. I'm sure all the ones that came in between have had gradual changes that may or may not have carried through to this one, but I actually expected it to be a lot more different than it actually is. Go figure.Some things are better. Some are worse.Battery life seems about the same to me. I live in the middle of nowhere and there's no cell service most places. My old one would last for weeks when I lived in the city but only a few days out here. Or maybe a week if I turned off wireless. This one about the same. With wireless on it's good for about 2 or 3 days. On airplane mode for much longer.It came at about ⅔ charge, which was a nice surprise.There's no way to have it auto-detect which books were loaded on the old Kindle and reload them, so that kinda sucks. Gonna be a long long long process to weed through them all. :((Improvements:- Waterproof. Haven't tested that yet, but they claim it is. The old one was hard, but certainly not waterproof.- Smaller than my old one. Guess that's both good and bad. My eyes are ok but they won't be forever. So less words on a page doesn't matter at normal size but might be an issue when enlarged. But it's a good size anyway. The old one was just big enough that it wouldn't fit in a pocket, which means this one will. Well, not a jeans pocket, but a large pants pocket or a coat pocket. So that's good. And the case adds almost no size (my old one's case add a lot of bulk.- the smaller size also means it's easy to hold and use with just one hand. So that's a plus.- more memory. LOTS more. That's nice.What's worse:- swipe to unlock. Even after I put a password on it, the swipe feature is still active and can't be disabled. And from what I've read, it came be disabled even if you pay to remove the ads. I don't mind the ads really. Sometimes they're useful (usually not, but sometimes). So now when I pick it up it's on the ad screen because it's locked. Then I hit the button and the password screen comes up. Enter the code and then it goes back to the ad screen instead of opening up. Won't open until I swipe at the page to unlock it. That's really annoying. Maybe I'll get used to it eventually. Shrug.- no speaker. So you can only use audio books by connecting via Bluetooth to another device. Which I don't have and so would have to pay money for.- and no speaker means it also doesn't have the text to talk feature that my old Touch had. I mean, it sucked, I know. Mispronounced many words and most names, and paused at weird places. But still was usable in a pinch. Now it's just gone.- the timeout feature is annoying. The old one had that too but it did it better. If I get distracted and it decided to timeout and lock, it first dims the screen, which looks like it's giving a warning with a last chance to tap the screen to prevent it locking. But really it's already too late and you have to wait for it to finish and then hit the power button. So I've spent an annoying few times frantically swiping at the screen to no avail.... The interface is different and takes some getting used to, but that's neither good nor bad. Just makes it hard to find some menu options at first.Overall, it's decent. Somewhat overpriced though. I could buy a cheap tablet or large screen phone, root it and delete everything, and install the Kindle app. Then I'd have something almost as good (better in some ways) for maybe half what they are charging here. And it would be color too, so my graphic novels wouldn't look like crap (seriously, don't even try and do picture books on this.) So overall, it's just okay.Still... I didn't try to send it back so I must like it, right?

author: Elsa Mei Arcilla
title: Dead Pixels, No Custom Pictures on Lockscreen
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Sub-par production quality of the display is very apparent and obvious. It isn’t flush to the surface, the gap is distracting.Mine has one dead pixel and I can’t decide if I should risk returning it and wasting all the time I spent on setting it up or I should gamble, exchange it for another one and waste twice as much time to set it up. Plus I’d be losing the amount paid for removing ads either way.It’s 2018 and it’s shocking to see that there’s no way to change the Images that you see on the lock screen when you open the cover. This device has this massive oversight, a feature we pretty much take for granted on the cheapest things you can buy today.Overall I don’t know why I spent twice more than a comparable reader for this. And I’m contemplating whether to get used to it or whether to return or exchange it.I highly recommend not getting this device. Look into kobo or literally any other e-ink display equipped tablet.

author: pc1000
title: Cannot hold a candle to the KIndle Fire
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Boy, if I wanted to see everything in black, white, and grey, I need only look out the window in Ohio in winter. No color, difficult to customize.  I DON'T WANT THEIR SUGGESTED READING, ETC.  I paid $20 extra to get it without ads.  It took about an hour before I packed it up to send it back.  I am going to try the Fire Tablet, even though it is too big. Sometimes, life sucks.  I was really looking forward to reading a book tonight.  Oh, wait.  I do have "real books"  I forgot about them.

author: R. Dennis Hall
title: I'm not sure it can be improved upon...
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I've owned and enjoyed most Amazon readers over the last 10 years and have never had any complaint with any of the devices.  The last generation Kindle Paperwhite was a superior device, as was the Kindle Voyage.  This Paperwhite seems to take the best of both and create a master device that exceeds the expectations for both.  I've had my new Paperwhite for several weeks now and I've come to the conclusion that Amazon may have great difficulty finding a way to make it better next time.  Is it really that good?  I think it's nothing short of a masterpiece.  The battery life is literally weeks for a constant user, the device is lighter and easier to handle over long periods than the last Paperwhite, the screen is of exceptional quality and durability due to the fact that it is harder and flush with the casing now.  There's another thing to add yet: It's a great bargain.  I traded my old Paperwhite for the new and paid 94.00 but I also got a brand new case for that price along with the device  I rarely feel moved to write reviews but my Kindle Paperwhite has been one of my favorite things for many years.  It really shocked me to step up a notch in an area in which I was already greatly satisfied.  Honestly though?  It was a big step up and I am very impressed.  I don't know that Amazon can pull off a trick like the All-New Paperwhite again.  I love it.  You know I think it was better than standing in line that last time for the last Harry Potter book!

author: Logan Berry
title: There’s no color
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: So I never write reviews. However after buying this as a gift for my brother and purchasing a BUNCH of comics on it for him to enjoy I was shocked to realize a $130 tablet reader was exclusively in black and white. It is 2018, people... my phone can video call people. Yet a newly produced $130 reader can’t show a comic book in color?! The product should not be advertised to be able to house comic books if it has no color. Color to a comic book is like sound to a television show. It IS a necessity. This is basically an electronic book, which is worse than a regular book as it basically dangles the amazing technology advances of our generation while throwing out the groundbreaking digital color from 1953.

author: Levi
title: New kindle paperwhite 2018 - Step back in some ways
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: 1) The USB cable did not fit the paperwhite. They are aware of the issue but are still shipping kindles with bad USB cables. when contacted they are sending a correct cable. 2) you can no longer swipe right to left to see you library, must select library link. Not terrible but change for no reason. 3) Sometime the new paperwhite does not respond, frozen for a bit (frustrating) 4) Home screen font is very small, seems harder to read than my previous paperwhite. 5) batter life is terrible compared to previous paperwhite which did in fact last for weeks. Mine has went down 30% in one day.  This puppy may be going back.  I would say wait to order and see if some of these issues are corrected with new software.

author: Christine Lovelace
title: holds a much longer charge
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I like the new version of Kindle Paperwhite. The new interface is smoother than the old. Can be a bit irritating when you accidentally brush the screen though, very sensitive. The only other drawback is the size is a tiny bit smaller than the last and none of my covers fit. Hmm, selling more covers i guess

author: Maheer M Kibria
title: Great Product with False Advertising
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: Without Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: First off let me say this kindle is better than the previous generation in almost every conceivable way. The new design aesthetics are a marked improvement. Not having a recessed display should mean less dust buildup in the edges. The display feels crisper and cleaner. And overall the device feels more responsive. However, I have 2 issues with this device. First is false advertising. This device is water resistant not water proof. At least according to the documentation in the box. Second is that the light is a lot cooler than the old light and I prefer the warmer feel of the old backlight

author: Amazon Customer
title: So far so good... Cable didn't fit but, a replacement is on it's way.
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I don't often write reviews, but in this instance I think it may help others. This is the first time I've had a Kindle, it arrived a day early and was easy to setup. However, the cable provided with the Paperwhite is the incorrect size. The micro USB end doesn't fit into the Paperwhite. I used the chat function on Amazon's website to ask about the issue. The Amazon representative provided a link to the replacement cable on Amazon and a credit to cover the cost. The replacement cable is on its way at no cost to me and it only took about 10 minutes from beginning of chat to the order completion.While looking into this issue, I found there are several other orders that have had this issue and only a couple reviews that mention how the issue was resolved. Hopefully this helps. I'm not sure how so many boxes received the wrong cable but am glad Amazon has a relatively quick solution. I have high hopes for this e-reader. We'll see what happens...

author: le petit Entrepreneur
title: heavy & not any good change compare to previous versions
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: this is my 7th kindle. I was expecting it to be faster processor & lighter, but it is the opposite compared to previous versions at cheaper price.The advertising is also disturbing as it is very slow to fade away when turning on the Kindle.Will send it back

author: Amazonite
title: Returned it
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: Without Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: This is my first Kindle.  I usually wait on new technology until all the bugs are out.  All the bugs are not out.1) This unit does not have the processing power to support smooth scrolling.  When I visit the home page to look at new books, there are scroll bars.  When I attempt to scroll with my finger, the page does not move with my finger as I would expect.  Instead it moves in big chunks after my finger has moved so far.  This behavior may have been acceptable ten years ago, but not now.  My eyes and brain expect the page to move along with my finger.  Consequently, I will not be using the home page for anything.2) This unit does not have the processing power to quickly handle page changes.  When I turn it on or go to new pages or go to settings or do anything that requires a refresh, I see new text on top of old for a brief second, which is distracting and just plain poor.  Also there are sometimes flashes of black screen added for further irritation.  Scrolling and changing pages are basic functions that the device should be able to handle smoothly.3) Pressing the left side of the screen to go to a previous page is totally unreliable.  Sometimes I'll get the previous page, sometimes I'll get the next page.  Multiple presses can cause looping.  Sometimes I get stuck in a loop between the next page and the current page, sometimes I'll get stuck in a loop between the previous page and the current page.4) As others have observed, the power plug is extremely difficult to connect.I do not recommend buying one of these.  I looked at reviews of the Oasis and the Fire and see more problems ahead.  For now I will stick with good old fashioned paper books.4 Dec 2018 update:  I tried the Kindle app on my android phone and it is vastly superior to the Kindle device.  Bright clear text, and the biggest plus by far is I can scroll pages smoothly up and down which is very intuitive and as fast as my finger can move.  Makes reading a pleasure rather than a chore.  Plus my phone is always with me so I don't have to carry around another device.  After comparing the two I don't know why anyone would want a Kindle.  Maybe someday when Kindles will have the processing power that phones have today enabling me to smoothly scroll through books instead of turning virtual pages I might consider one since they have more screen space than a phone.

author: David L. Parnell
title: Wow...little things matter...
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: The first thing I liked about my new Kindle was the box.  I could see the significant thought in both the materials and the design.  My first Kindle which I still use has endured YEARS of use and travel though the battery in it is now failing and the charge only lasts 2-3 days.  All of its buttons still work and its screen is a perfect display for text.  Years ago it was supported with both 3G and WiFi capability which set it apart from any e-reader of its day (I loved such superior design).  Now as soon as I opened the box for my new Kindle I began to see superior design again.  While it looked naked without all the keyboard buttons at the bottom or the paging buttons on the side, I was pleased with its crisp display and its ease of the auto setup menu.  Supposedly it is waterproof but I won't deliberately try to validate this feature.  (My old keyboard Kindle worked just fine in a ziplock plastic bag when used around water.)  I often wake at night and have to turn on a light in order to read my old Kindle (which I keep under my pillow).  This new "paper white" Kindle has it own light which is a great improvement for night time use.  My library was immediately down loaded into this new Kindle for which I was greatly pleased.  I was afraid to buy a new Kindle thinking I was being disloyal to my old Kindle...a trusted friend capable of calming my soul on a bad day or simply entertaining or educating me with the push of a button.  If I went camping or boarding an airline, my Kindle was my constant companion and my intellectual superior ready to mentor me in an instance.  I could not "trade in" my old friend.  If it reaches a severe state of decline, I will retire it on a shelf alongside my old slide rule as a reminder that some technology really does advance human capabilities.  So, for now, I will continue to appreciate my new "paper white" Kindle as a new friend with new adventures and deep thought ahead as we daily enter the future with its curiosity and discovery in the elation and enlightenment of the gift of life.

author: KatieR
title: Beware if you want/need/expect cellular connectivity when you pay extra for wireless
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I travel a lot to places without secure internet access, and have always relied on the Kindle cellular connectivity. I ordered this latest paperwhite because we live on a boat and the warer-resistance feature was significant to me.  I ordered the 8 gig version; I didn’t think I needed more. Well, it does NOT have cellular connectivity!!I spent nearly Four hours on the phone with Amazon explaining that I needed cellular connectivity.  A replacement was sent - and it was the the exact same thing!!!  NO cellular connectivity.  Another two hours on the phone; finally told for him he FIRST tme that cellular connectivity is ONLY available with the twice-the-price 32 gig version!!!  I went back to website - the Kindle is advertised as a version that has wi-fi + cellular connectivity. It NO WHERE  indicated to hat you have to buy the expensive 32 gig version to have  cellular connectivity included when you pay extra for wireless.  This is so he 6th(!) Kindle I have ordered, and every one of then until now had cellular connectivity.  The Kindle website gives absolutely no indication that the 8 gig does not include cellular connectivity - indeed, the specs for ordering state “wireless + cellular connectivity.”After all my years of loyalty to the Kindle, I disappointed and angry at what appears to be a false product description and a blatant Bait and Switch.  The remedy offered was a $35 credit in consideration of the six plus hours I spent on the phone, making it crystal clear I needed cellular connectivity!  I am disgusted with the time I spent on this issue, only to FINALLY be told that I needed to pay double for a 32 gig version, which is nowhere indicated in the Kindle product descriptions.

author: rafael rodriguez
title: Simplemente, una excelente compra ! vale la pena 100%
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Este es mi primer Kindle. Decidi comprarlo debido a lo incomodo que se hacia leer un libro en el transporte publico y lo deteriorado que quedaban los libros al terminarlos.Ha sido la mejor comprar de mi 2018. Cosas a resaltar:-Durabilidad de la bateria- Su peso ligero- lo rapido que se suben los libros comprados a la nube para leerlos inmediatamente- el dinero que poco a poco te vas ahorrando a medida que vas comprando libros ya que estos E-books son mas economicos que los fisicos- el diccionario incluido por si hay alguna palabra (ya que suelo leer los libros en ingles) que no te sepas no te detengas a buscar en el diccionario.- el poder hacer notas o resaltar algun parrafo de algo que te haya parecido interesante. Asi al final del libro podras revisar todas tus notas acerca del libroEn conclusion los mejores 100 euros que he gastado. lo recomiendo 100%

author: phoenix
title: Charging cable/connector problem
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Compared to Kindle desktop or smartphone apps, this real Kindle is a bit slower. On the positive side, it's very light weight and easy on eyes.------------------------------------Before I even received the new Kindle Paperwhite, I got a welcome email from Amazon in which it casually mentioned small number of users are having trouble inserting the included USB cable into the device. Upon receiving the new Kindle I found I had the exact problem. But I have a Samsung Android phone charging cable so I was able to charge the Kindle. Later I found two more USB to Micro USB cables at home so I tried them. One worked and one didn't. So the problem isn't exactly on the included cable. It's more like a problem on the Micro USB connector on the Kindle. So if you're unfortunate enough to run into this problem you can try a different cable at home. I think over the time the connector will loosen up a little bit and eventually will work for all reasonably good cables.If you still want to get a new cable from Amazon, look in Amazon's welcome email. There is a paragraph mentioning this issue in which there is a link you can click for support. I chatted with Amazon and they said I need to order a cable from Amazon then contact them again. Once the cable is shipped they will credit the money back to you.Also within two hours the new Kindle crashed. I just pushed and held the power button long enough to make it reboot (for about 10-15 seconds). So far it hasn't crashed yet. So don't panic if that happens to you. We live in a world where we sometimes just have to reboot.

author: Cathy
title: Customer services rocks
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Thanks you for listening to me and for the update that fixed my concerns.  Customer service still exists!  This is my updated review

author: loraine
title: TURN OFF THE BLUETOOTH!
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Update: Initially I didn’t have the battery life issue but I hadn’t turned on the Bluetooth. My kindle updated turned it on and it started killing my battery really quick like less than a day. My one other minor complaint is where the on off button is located I turn my kindle of accidentally a lot it should be moved or recessed.So happy I upgraded my Paperwhite. The things I like better about the new Paperwhite are: It weighs less, the flat front, it’s waterproof and the auto light sensor.It’s like an ounce lighter that makes a huge difference when marathon reading.The flat front is so much better you don’t have to lift your fingers from edge to turn pages. That doesn’t sound like much but it matters. Also the flat front doesn’t let stuff get stuck around the bezel like dog hair.It’s waterproof, that was my justification to upgrade. I float in the pool and read A LOT. I haven’t gotten it wet to try this feature out but if it happens and it’s not waterproof I’ll update my review.The light sensor is awesome. I did adjust my last kindle frequently and I don’t need to do that now.  I keep my light adjustment on the dim side.I loved my last Paperwhite but I think this one is definitely better. The battery life has been excellent. I went on a car trip and probably used it 18 hours over a 5 day trip on one charge with battery left.

author: V. Brown Machann
title: Lovely product, but on opening it have huge questions
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Yesterday I got the cover. I thought I'd ordered blue; it is brown.More importantly, today I got the kindle and the charger cord.  I have had previous kindles and have an I-phone.  Neither the one that was enclosed with the reader nor my I-phone charger; I can't find my old kindle charger (part of the reason I ordered a new one) but since these at least go in the outer level, I don't think those would work either.  At this point I am in no position to rate it,

author: Stephen Burket
title: Kindle Paperwhite works in the sun or the dark.
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: So far it's awesome. I have a Kindle Fire an have problems reading in the sun. This Paperwhite works in the sun or the dark. It's great for reading anywhere. It's small and light.

author: Michael Cardone
title: Unless you need more space or waterproofing use an older one.
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: Without Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: This was my first paperwhite and so something touted as grand as this for the price tag, especially for the increased price tag that I paid, which amounted to 184 USD and change I was expecting something really good. The price is currently 180 USD and at the time of my purchase the base version was more like 120 USD.My main gripes are the poor UI that looks like something from a Nokia phone models back before flip phones existed, but after cell phones became more main stream. The glare-free screen is actually an anti-glare that negates the sharp light reflected off it from what I guess is the frosted screen. There's this annoying lag that also inverts the color when you flip through pages or try to use the native reading of a pdf file. From there it goes downhill to how the battery life isn't quite as promised, the paperwhite only comes with the micro USB and no actual charger so you have to plug it into another charger or a laptop, which takes well over the promised 4 hours charge time. There is no actual off, only sleep and turning off the screen so your device will most likely arrive half dead.Originally this was advertised as immersive with audiobooks and it made it seem like you could listen and read along, you can't. The waterproofing might work, but the mass produced care and maintenance notice tells you to not get it what and to quickly dry it off, the store page I believe advertises up to 2 feet in fresh water for an hour.A minor complaint is that it was already tied to my account upon receiving it, granted this was my first Amazon product of this nature so I just thought it was creepy. I later got a Fire7 to test the differences and at least bothered to ask if this was me or not.Also Amazon products really, really, really seem to hate any attempt at trying to use non-Amazon products on them. For the paperwhite I was trying to load up my library of Tabletop RPG books and figured an e-reader, especially this new one that touted native pdf reading (as previous generations didn't have that) would work well. It's really bad as a pdf reader at this price tag. (The Fire has issues trying to get GooglePlay or anything sideloaded as well, but that's another product). If you like reading regular text only books in a standard non-column format that is available from Amazon, then the paperwhite is amazing, you could also probably just get an older generation for cheaper unless you really need it to be waterproof.Sorry if this review isn't as organized or well written as it should be, but there was an error while trying to submit and I can't retype everything perfectly.

author: Mike
title: Best Entry Kindle Yet
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I preordered this to replace my last generation Kindle. I read a lot and mostly in 3 areas - Outside in the sun, in bed in no light and indoors during the day. I like the ease of adjusting the backlight as needed to read in the different environment.I don’t know what could be included in the next iteration of the Paperwhite as this one is about perfect.

author: Kindle Customer
title: 32GB  Garbage
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: This device is garbage, and so is Amazon and its software developers.Unresponsiveness is the primary flaw of any computer system. Not letting the user know what's going on is a close second. Amazon gets 5 stars for both flaws.I had intended to upgrade my Paperwhite bought in May 2018 with this new 32GB version. I own over 5,000 kindle books and numerous Kindles. I'm a former software developer.As of now my device has 24.41 GB of 27.3 GB free. It lags, it won't sync, it won't download dictionaries or covers, or find recently bought books. It's locked up numerous times requiring a restart and crashed a couple times.It will however always refresh Amazon's ads.Nice job, Amazon.But i

author: threeofsix
title: Great as always, but underwhelming compared to previous paperwhites
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: Paperwhites are fantastic, and have been my favorite devices I own. I would give this model 5 stars, but the changes are underwhelming compared to my Paperwhite 2 (2013 model), and not all of them for the better. If you don't have a Paperwhite, you should get this. If you have an older model, your mileage may vary. My main takeaways are:- Flush front feels nice and is easier to keep clean.- The light is much bluer than my PW2. I'm most disappointed by this, and probably would have given it 5 stars if not for this issue alone.- Inverting screen colors is nice for night reading, but should have been ported to all models. Disappointed they didn't add a warm light like Kobo and Nook have had for years.- The screen resolution is higher than my PW2, and the same as the PW3. But on the other hand, it seems subtly grayer, with poorer contrast, and greater glare. I'd still call it an overall improvement over the PW2, but didn't expect such a trade-off.- Adds waterproofing, Audible support, greater storage, and smaller size. All nice additions, but not a huge draw to me.- PW3 had a black logo that blended in with the front. This model goes back to a silver logo. It usually isn't distracting, but still a step backwards in my opinion.

author: Barnet Hellman
title: Amazon Took An Incredible Product and Destroyed It
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I have no idea why companies take incredible products and destroy them.  Not only did this Paperwhite not start up, but I spent over 2 hrs talking to Support just to get it registered.  My Voyager - 10 min top to get it so I was reading.  This device, believe it or not, is SLOWER than my Voyager - a 5 year old device.It did not download my Collections or my unread books.  I had to open my Voyager get that list and one-by-one queue the books for downloading - my "idiot" thought that was a great idea; just download everything.Unlike my Voyager, you cannot have your Collections and your unread books together one after the other.  No clue why.  The Support guy on the phone said I could, but he could not figure it out either.  So now I have to search thru 207 books and download those that I have not read -- using my Voyager list to do that.My Collections are all "No Items" on the Paperwhite, yet on my Voyager, all the book are in the correct Collection.  WTFWhy take a great product and break it.....

author: Phoebe
title: Light, waterproof e-reader. Exactly as ordered!
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I love the kindle e-readers. Previously, I had the 7th generation that I bought back in 2013. You just can't beat the backlight with the kindle e-readers, they are the best on the market in my opinion.I bought this mainly for the waterproof feature. It also has more storage space and some of the features (Goodreads, for example) have been updated. Another huge plus is having audiobooks on this kindle (though you do need a blu-tooth headphone set). I listen to a TON of audiobooks, so this is super useful for me. Also the 6 months of kindle unlimited doesn't hurt. The battery lasts much longer than my old paper white and as mentioned before, it is notably lighter than my old one.For me, this was well worth the money because of the type of reader I am. The only minor gripe I would have is that sometimes I accidentally touch the screen and it goes on to the next page before I am done reading (an issue I had with the previous kindle paper white too), but it's a minor more logistical issue.I think this generation came with a lot of improvements. The only real issue is that there are not a lot of cases available to go along with this e-reader (I found a gorgeous one that was a bit pricey), but if you're planning to use it near water then that might be for the best anyway.Love this reader for sure! If you happen to have the money and are thinking about upgrading, I definitely recommend you do so.

author: M Robinson
title: Not so big an improvement, really
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I traded in my beloved 7th gen for the new 10th.  Double capacity, a tad extra light to read in the dark with (one of my *favorite* features).  Other than those two bonuses, the 10th is a decided several steps backwards.First one arrived the day after release - total lemon.  No cushioning in the comparatively huge shipping box which may have contributed to its problems, the device was absurdly non-responsive, took nearly 10 minutes just to register basic info - and that was skipping all extras.  After speaking with THREE customer service reps in India (srsly), I was instructed to return the device for an exchange.  The next morning, a "special team" member began emailing me with instructions on how to return it on Amazon's dim.  I re-packaged the reader in the same box it arrived in and dropped it off with UPS.The next business day, my replacement arrived.  This one proved to be much better than its unfortunate predecessor.  However, the 10th gen still has what I consider to be puzzling issues.  As mentioned by others, it is sluggish, especially when compared to the 7th.  A page often needs to be swiped two or three times before anything happens.  Downloading a single book is very fast, but anything more than three books queued causes catastrophic failure (refuse to dl or cherry-picks which ones it *does* download).Whoever decided that reading a mere HALF HOUR A DAY is what the average purchaser of a purely reading device does really should rethink.  The battery (even on the 7th) will NOT last "weeks", even if you do not use the light or read for more than a half hour a day.  If you use the back light at all - one of the major advantages of the Paperwhite - your battery will drain in days, maybe a week, depending on how much you read.  Today was the first time I've used the back light, and the battery is noticeably drained after only an *hour* with the light set relatively low.Of course, now I can drop my reader in the bathtub or a pond for an hour, and theoretically it'll be fine.  Whooptidoo.Overall, I'm not impressed with the 10th gen.  But I do love the Paperwhite in general.  We have a seriously large 'real' library at home, and this adds over a thousand electronic volumes (so far) to it as well as the ability to check out library books to read at odd hours, while camping, etc.  Except for the added storage, I almost wish I had my 7th gen back.

author: MichelleMG9
title: “Upgraded” Kindle a Terrible Disappointment
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 32Offer Type: Without Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: This is my 3rd kindle and by far the absolute worst.  If I could snap my fingers & have my previous kindle back, I’d do so in a heartbeat. I have a large digital library so the main reason I went for the upgrade was for more storage capacity & faster processor.* I purchased the 32GB storage capacity and found it was false advertising. Brand new, the storage capacity is 27GB. Amazon should be honest about the actual storage capacity-I still would have purchased the 27GB storage but don’t appreciate being lied to.* The Kindle Gen6 is what I traded-in & other than the storage capacity, my biggest frustration was the slow processor speed. Shame on me for not researching more, but this Gen10 kindle does not improve this issue & I find is even a bit slower than my Gen6 was.* The battery is worse on this kindle than my previous version. As others have stated, if you leave it connected via WiFi it drains the battery to 0 in less than 30 minutes.  In airplane mode, it’s better but not as good as my previous kindles were. I suspect we’ll see battery life deteriorate with each new kindle version in order to encourage users to upgrade more often.* Size of the Gen10 is a teeny tiny bit smaller than previous versions so of course you can’t use your existing cover on it & have to buy a new one.* Books do not automatically download during the set up process as it did with the Gen6. This is a huge pain for anyone with a large library esp bc Amazon does not let you manage/view your content by Collection.  Amazon should work on something to better the “Manage your content & devices” section to make it a better customer experience.* Collections-where to begin on this mess.  I found out the hard way that when you add/remove books from your collections on the kindle, it does not always transfer the info back to Amazon’s site. --> My digital content was so messed up that I decided to clean it up on the site & then reset the Gen10 & set it up again. This tooks hours & hours bc the Amazon site is not user friendly at all. --> Even after my clean up on the Amazon site, some books downloaded into the wrong collections. I double checked the site & it was correct too but the books showed up on the Gen10 in the incorrect collections. -->After the reset, I did not push any books to the Gen10 from the site & manually downloaded books only from a few of my collections. Yet this kindle automatically downloaded more but not all of my library to the kindle. So I’ll spend more hours cleaning this up on the Gen10 to get it organized.I received this new Kindle on Jan 28, and as of today Feb10 I am still working to get the device and content set up properly.  I would NOT advise anyone to purchase this Kindle.  It’s not a fix for a very slow processor speed and has bugs.  If you have a decent working Kindle then this is not the “upgrade” I’d recommend.

author: Alan B
title: Small,  touch screen only device.
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: The look and feel are very different than I expected.  Not a fan of touch screens these days as too many evinces seem to have screens that are too easily damaged.  Very small in size from the more original models and its so not the same white screen.  Maybe it will be better, maybe it will grow on me.  The charging plug is extremely difficult to insert, thought it would break before it finally snapped into place.  Even then, it's taken several experiments to get the charge to actually get going.  Not sure I'd recommend it to anyone at the moment.  Only got this because my older device broke, totally user fault when it got smashed in the car trunk with other stuff by accident.

author: Desiree B.
title: Disappointing and worse for children's books
types: Digital Storage Capacity: 8Offer Type: With Special OffersColor: BlackOption: Without Kindle Unlimited
body: I admit, I should have done more research in advance, but I was shocked when the Kindle arrived. I wanted a device for my grandchildren (ages 5 and 9)  to read, without being distracted by games.  It is extremely lightweight for sure, but it is tiny.  The amount of actual page size is only 3 x 4, and with a reasonable font size (for small children or older adults) barely a paragraph of text displays.In addition, the screen response is extremely slow taking well over a second to turn pages, with a very distracting flashing fade in/out for any graphics on the page, especially when changing screens (returning home, etc.).  Response time on the actual touch screens is very slow for anyone used to using a tablet.The most disappointing for me is that it is all black and white.  It honestly never occurred to me that children's books would be black and white as well.  As I bought this as a gift for my grandchildren to read library books and such, I don't think this will be used at all (who wants a gorgeous picture book in black and white?).  It will be returned...for the almost $200 cost (with cover and charger, etc.) I expected much more.Update:  Received a call from Amazon to try to resolve some of my issues.  Really appreciated, but in discussion, tried downloading more children's books that I had previously purchased through Amazon.
